meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or progress.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah outraces the tortoise effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The hare outraces the turtle in the famous fable.
meanings.sent3: The sports car outraces the old truck on the highway.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed outraces any obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The wind outraces the storm, clearing the skies in minutes.

meanings.definition: To move faster than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The sprinter outraces his competitors to the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit outraces the squirrel in the race for the last acorn.
meanings.sent3: The giggling child outraces the tired parent in the park.
meanings.sent4: His excitement outraces his ability to speak coherently.
meanings.sent5: The river outraces the melting snow, rushing downstream with force.

meanings.definition: To exceed in a race or competition.
meanings.sent1: She outraces all her opponents in the swimming competition.
meanings.sent2: The champion outraces the challengers in every event.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outraces the hounds in the hunt for food.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to practice outraces his fear of failure.
meanings.sent5: The rising sun outraces the moon, signaling the start of a new day.
